alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 5:27AM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Big Sandy Creek at US 441 near Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Bankfull conditions are reached along the river. The Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and right bank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge...will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 9.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 23 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.1 feet on 09/30/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
